pytenno.utils

Module for utility functions used elsewhere in the pytenno package.

Some of these functions are used to convert data types to and from their respective JSON representations.

There are also a handful of user-friendly functions for common tasks, such as converting a string to a valid url-safe string.

pytenno.utils.format_name(name: str)[source]

Converts a string to a valid url-safe string.

pytenno.utils.from_data(cls_: T, data: dict[str, Any] | None) → Type[T][source]

Partially converts common data types into their object equivalent, then creates an instance of cls_.

pytenno.utils.is_formatted_name(name: str)[source]

Checks if a string is a valid formatted name.
